com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Gameobjects

Class RenderBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Gameobjects.AbstractGameObject
      • com.BombingGames.WurfelEngine.Core.Gameobjects.RenderBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasID, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatedBlock

    public class RenderBlock
extends AbstractGameObject
    A RenderBlock is a wonderful piece of information and a geometrical object. It is something which can be rendered and therefore render information saved. A RenderBlock should not be shared across cameras.
    See Also:
    CoreData, Serialized Form

      • spawn

        public RenderBlock spawn(Coordinate coord)
        places the object on the map. You can extend this to get the coordinate. RenderBlock may be placed without this method call.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • hasSides

        public boolean hasSides()
        Is the block a true block with three sides or does it get rendered by a single sprite?
        This field is only used for representation (view) related data.
        Returns:
        true if it has sides, false if is rendered as a single sprite

        This field is only used for representation (view) related data.
        Parameters:
        hasSides - true if it has sides, false if is rendered as a single sprite

                   int xPos,

      • render

        public void render(GameView view,
                   int xPos,
                   int yPos,
                   com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color,
                   boolean staticShade)
        Renders the whole block at a custom position.
        Parameters:
        view - the view using this render method
        xPos - rendering position
        yPos - rendering position
        color - when the block has sides its sides gets shaded using this color.
        staticShade - makes one side brighter, opposite side darker

        Render a side of a block at the position of the coordinates.
        Parameters:
        view - the view using this render method
        camera -
        coords - the coordinates where to render
        side - The number identifying the side. 0=left, 1=top, 2=right
        staticShade -

      • renderSide

        public void renderSide(View view,
                       int xPos,
                       int yPos,
                       Side side)
        Ignores lightlevel.
        Parameters:
        view - the view using this render method
        xPos - rendering position
        yPos - rendering position
        side - The number identifying the side. 0=left, 1=top, 2=right

      • renderSide

        public void renderSide(View view,
                       int xPos,
                       int yPos,
                       Side side,
                       com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color color)
        Draws a side of a block at a custom position. Apllies color before rendering and takes the lightlevel into account.
        Parameters:
        view - the view using this render method
        xPos - rendering position
        yPos - rendering position
        side - The number identifying the side. 0=left, 1=top, 2=right
        color - a tint in which the sprite gets rendered. If null lightlevel gets ignored

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Overwrite to define what should happen (view only) if the block is getting destroyed? Sets the value to -1. So be carefull when to call super.onDestroy().
        Since:
        v1.4
